title: When AI can fake reality, who can you trust? - Sam Gregory

multiple-choice.question: What is the main concern about the increasing use of generative AI?

options.label: A
options.text: It will create more jobs in the tech industry.

options.label: B
options.text: It will make it easier to spot fake information.

options.label: C
options.text: It will contribute to societal problems and make it harder to discern fact from fiction.

options.text: It will reduce the cost of producing media content.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the global effort coordinated by WITNESS to address the challenges of deepfakes?

options.label: A
options.text: They are too easy to spot.

options.label: B
options.text: They are too difficult to create.

options.label: C
options.text: Detection tools often only work on one single way to make a deepfake, and they don't work well on low-quality social media content.

options.label: D
options.text: They are only used for malicious purposes.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of adding invisible watermarking to AI-generated media?

options.label: A
options.text: To make it more difficult to spot deepfakes.

options.label: B
options.text: To add cryptographically signed metadata to files.

options.label: C
options.text: To provide details about the content, including how AI was used to create or edit it.

options.label: D
options.text: To reduce the cost of producing media content.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge in creating a pipeline of responsibility for AI?

options.label: A
options.text: Ensuring that governments are transparent and accountable.

options.label: B
options.text: Ensuring that companies are transparent and accountable.

options.label: C
options.text: Ensuring that the pipeline of responsibility runs from the foundation models and open-source projects through to the platforms where we consume media and communicate.

options.label: D
options.text: Ensuring that the pipeline of responsibility is only used for malicious purposes.

multiple-choice.question: What is the risk of not taking steps to address the challenges of deepfakes?

options.label: A
options.text: That it will become easier to spot fake information.

options.label: B
options.text: That it will become easier to create deepfakes.

options.label: C
options.text: That it will become easier to fake reality and dismiss reality as potentially faked.

options.label: D
options.text: That it will reduce the cost of producing media content.

multiple-choice.question: What is the quote from Hannah Arendt that describes the risk of a world where it's easier to fake reality and dismiss reality as potentially faked?

options.label: A
options.text: "A people that no longer can believe anything cannot make up its own mind."

options.label: B
options.text: "A people that no longer can think and judge cannot make up its own mind."

options.label: C
options.text: "A people that no longer can act cannot make up its own mind."

options.label: D
options.text: "A people that no longer can believe anything cannot think and judge."

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge in creating durable signs of how AI and human were mixed in media content?

options.label: A
options.text: Ensuring that they don't compromise privacy.

options.label: B
options.text: Ensuring that they don't backfire globally.

options.label: C
options.text: Ensuring that they are reliable, updatable, and secure.

options.label: D
options.text: Ensuring that they are only used for malicious purposes.

options.label: A
options.text: To make it more difficult to spot deepfakes.

options.label: B
options.text: To provide details about the content, including how AI was used to create or edit it.

options.label: C
options.text: To reduce the cost of producing media content.

options.label: D
options.text: To ensure that the pipeline of responsibility is transparent and accountable.

options.text: Because they are not interested in learning about pandas.

options.label: B

title: The science of laughter - Sasha Winkler

options.text: Because laughter is a way to express emotions and relieve stress.

options.text: Because laughter involves the contraction of abdominal muscles, altering breathing patterns, and inhibiting reflexes.

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
